(45) 178.19th March, 1945.WAR CABINET.LOCAL GOVERNMENT REFORM.Memorandum by the Minister of Health.1. I "attach a draft Bill to give effect to the proposals in the White paper on Local Government during the Period of Reconstruction. This Paper was discussed at a meeting of the War Cabinet on the 20th December last andwas approved, subject to certain amendments which were subsequentlyincorporated (W.M. (44) 172nd Conclusions, Minute 3).2. The Paper was debated in the House of Commons on the 15th february and a motion welcoming its proposals was carried without dissent, Members fromall quarters of the House expressing approval of the idea of a Local GovernmentBoundary Commission.3. The Bill establishes a Local Government Boundary Commission (Clause 1and First Schedule), and empowers it to make orders adjusting Local government areas (Clause 2). The powers conferred on the Commission take the place of those contained in the Local Government Act, 1933. The Minister of Health is empowered to make regulations laying down principles for the guidance of theCommission and regulating their procedure and these regulations require an affirmative resolution of each House. Orders affecting counties or county boroughs are expressed in the Bill to be " provisional " (Clause 3 (7) ), but theintention is that if the proposed Statutory Orders (Special Procedure) Billbecomes lav/, they shall be subject to the procedure laid down in that Bill. TheMinister is also empowered to give directions as to the priority in which theCommission are to deal with cases (Clause 3 (4)). When an area has beenconsidered by the Commission, a period of ten years must normally elapse before any further alteration can be made (Clause 3 (6)).4. I am anxious, if possible, to publish the Bill early in the Easter recess,and I seek authority to present it before Parliament rises, subject to any draftingadjustments which may be recommended by the Legislation Committee, to whichit will, if approved, be submitted on the 27th March,H. U. W.Ministry of Health, Whitehall. S.W.1,19th March, 1945.[29462]
